isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - WINDSHIELD (BEFORE JULY 1993)

svcprocinfo.para: The windshield used with the cab is a one- piece, flat, glass type. A molded weather seal (weatherstrip) with an integral insert fits the perimeter of the glass to retain the glass in the windshield opening. When replacing windshield, always use a new weather seal since a used weather seal is likely to be stretched or deteriorated and prone to leaks.

note.para: Effective July 1993, International vehicles have a windshield that is slightly larger all around and has a re-designed sealer (windshield retainer). This re-designed windshield assembly will be covered in detail in this section as noted.

warning.para: When removing or installing windshield glass, wear gloves.

svcprocinfo.para: If either the windshield or weather seal must be replaced, procedure is as follows:

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Remove washer hose (Item 1, Figure 3) from wiper arm (Item 2, Figure 3) and remove wiper arm from top of cowl. Refer to WIPER ARM, Remove.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 4for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Pry Locking Strip Insert From Weather Seal

step1.para: Pry integral or detached locking strip insert (Item 2) from weather seal (Item 3) with a thin screwdriver or seal tool (Item 1) around entire glass.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 5for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Working with one person outside the cab and an assistant inside, apply light pressure on the windshield from inside of cab to push the glass from the weather seal (Item 3). Be careful during this operation since heavy pressure at any one point can lead to glass breakage.
Lift glass from opening and peel weather seal (Item 3) from body flange (weld flange) (Item 4).

svcsubproc.title: Install

note.para: Adhesive sealer is not required for this windshield installation.

warning.para: Wear gloves when removing or installing windshield glass.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 5for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before installing new weather seal (Item 3) or windshield, clean body flange (Item 4) and glass free of dirt, wax, etc.
Coat weather seal (Item 3) with a soapy solution or rubber lubricant for ease of assembly.
Install weather seal (Item 3) carefully around edge of windshield body flange opening. Position splice joint of weather seal ends at the center line of the cab on the lower body flange (Item 4).
Working from outside the cab, place windshield in the channel of weather seal (Item 3), starting at lower edge of opening.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 4for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Starting at the lower center of windshield, work locking strip insert (Item 2) down into groove provided around entire weather seal (Item 3). Use seal tool (Item 1) or a dull screwdriver to seat locking strip insert in the groove. A second coat of rubber lubricant in groove will simplify installation.
Install wiper arm (Item 2, Figure 3) on top of cowl. Install washer hose (Item 1, Figure 3) onto wiper arm. Refer to WIPER ARM, Install.

note.para: When replacing a windshield that does not have re-designed glass and weather seal, it is recommended that the re-designed windshield assembly be used.
